title: Hollyoaks' Gloved Hand Killer speaks out: 'I couldn't ask for a better storyline' - Hollyoaks Soaps -
text: Warning: This article contains spoilers from Wednesday's E4 first look episode that some readers may prefer to avoid.Hollyoaks star Sophie Austin has spoken out following the big reveal that her character Lindsey Butterfield is the Gloved Hand Killer.Long-awaited scenes in Wednesday's E4 first look episode saw the mystery villain unmasked as Lindsey dished out a lethal injection to her own husband Freddie Roscoe (Charlie Clapham).Austin has now provided an instant reaction to the story twist in a behind-the-scenes video recorded on the Hollyoaks set, which can be viewed below. "It's been a bit hard to keep it a secret, especially from other castmates," she admitted. "It's been quite nice knowing stuff that other people don't know and you can play up to it. It's absolutely brilliant - I couldn't ask for a better storyline so I'm pleased."On the shock that Lindsey has such a sinister side, Austin added: "She has a split personality. She is that loving person that you've known and liked for two and a half years, but she does have this side as well. "I'm very sad to see the end of Lindsey and Freddie. It was a very emotional scene. Charlie is one of my bestest friends and so dear to my heart." Â© Lime PicturesSophie Austin as Lindsey Butterfield While viewers are now aware of Lindsey's guilt, the storyline is about to enter a whole new chapter as the rest of the villagers will be blissfully unaware of her true colours.Pondering who could be the next unlucky victim, Austin laughed: "It could be an interfering Cindy, a very sexy Mercedes, an annoying little sister Kim.
